Midas Documentation » SECTION 5: Run Control » Run Control Programs » mhttpd: the MIDAS Web-based Run Control utility

Equipment page




How to Display the Equipment Page

The Equipment Page is displayed by clicking on one of the Equipment Hyperlinks on the main status page.
This provides a short-cut so the user may see the contents of the defined banks for that equipment providing that the data from the Equipment is being sent to the ODB because either

  • the RO_ODB flag or
  • the History value

in the corresponding Equipment List is non-zero.

In this case, the /Equipment/<equipment-name>/Variables/ subdirectory ( where "<equipment-name>" is replaced with the name of the defined equipment) is filled by the associated frontend (see SECTION 6: Frontend Operation and the ODB /Equipment tree). The data is written into array(s) with the same name(s) as the bankname(s).

The data of Equipments that do not have either of these flags set cannot be viewed in this way. Instead it can be viewed with mdump or an analyzer.


Naming the Equipment data

The Equipment data is displayed on the Equipment page using either the default names or names assigned by the user, if a "Names" array has been created. The following examples illustrate both cases.

Examples of named Equipment data

  • MIDAS format:
    • Data from an Equipment with one bank using the default Names
    • Named data from an Equipment with one bank
    • Named data from an Equipment with two banks of the same length
    • Event containing two Named Banks of different sizes
    • Names array Grouped for a large number of elements in a bank
  • FIXED format:
    • Fixed-Format event with named Variables
    • Fixed-Format event with defined Names array

Data from an Equipment with one bank using the default Names

The main Status page from an experiment with two Equipments defined ("TpcGasPlc" and "Detector") is shown below. Clicking the Equipment Hyperlink "Detector" (circled in green) will show the data from /Equipment/Detector/Variables. This illustration shows how the mhttpd display combines the names of the variables in a MIDAS format event with the variables read out in the equipment's data bank.
The "Detector" equipment has one bank only (SCLR) which is an array of 10 data words. The "Names" column shows the default name, which is derived from the bankname and the array element number , i.e. "SCLR[0]...SCLR[9]".




Clicking on the "Detector" Equipment Hyperlink shows SCLR bank contents with default Names





The corresponding ODB data is shown below using odbedit.

[local:t2kgas:S]Variables>ls /Equipment/Detector/Variables -lt
Key name                        Type    #Val  Size  Last Opn Mode Value
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
SCLR                            DWORD   10    4     55m  0   RWD
                                        [0]             3453
                                        [1]             2701
                                        [2]             896
                                        [3]             4351
                                        [4]             2051
                                        [5]             1467
                                        [6]             1952
                                        [7]             4931
                                        [8]             783
                                        [9]             902



Named data from an Equipment with one bank

It is often helpful to define an individual name for each element of the databank. This is done by creating an array called "Names" in the /Equipment/<equipment-name>/Settings/ subdirectory, with the same number of elements as the databank. This array is then filled by the user with a suitable name corresponding to each element in the databank. This procedure is shown here using the mhttpd ODB page commands , or with odbedit below:

[local:t2kgas:S]>cd /Equipment/Detector
[local:t2kgas:S]>mkdir Settings
[local:t2kgas:S]Detector>cd Settings
[local:t2kgas:S]Settings>create string Names[10]
String length [32]:
[local:t2kgas:S]Settings>set Names[0] LeftFront
[local:t2kgas:S]Settings>set Names[1] LeftCentre
[local:t2kgas:S]Settings>ls
Names
                                LeftFront
                                LeftCentre








[local:t2kgas:S]Settings>


Now when the hyperlink "Detector" is clicked, the elements of the SCLR bank will be named using data from the Names array as follows:




Clicking on "Detector" Equipment Hyperlink shows SCLR bank contents with defined Names





The complete Names array is shown below using odbedit :

[local:t2kgas:S]settings>ls -lt
Key name                        Type    #Val  Size  Last Opn Mode Value
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Names                           STRING  10    32    22m  0   RWD
                                        [0]             LeftFront
                                        [1]             LeftCentre
                                        [2]             LeftBack
                                        [3]             RightFront
                                        [4]             RightCentre
                                        [5]             RightBack
                                        [6]             MidFront
                                        [7]             MidCentre
                                        [8]             MidBack
                                        [9]             Dump



Named data from an Equipment with two banks of the same length

Sometimes the data consists of more than one bank that corresponds to the same list of names, i.e. both banks have the same length. In that case, the Names array will refer to both, e.g.

Clicking on "Detector" Equipment Hyperlink shows SCLR and TDCT bank contents with the same defined Names





The "Detector" equipment now has two banks (SCLR and TDCT) which are both arrays of 10 data words:

[local:t2kgas:S]Variables>ls /Equipment/Detector/Variables -lt
Key name                        Type    #Val  Size  Last Opn Mode Value
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
SCLR                            DWORD   10    4     55m  0   RWD
                                        [0]             3453
                                        [1]             2701
                                        [2]             896
                                        [3]             4351
                                        [4]             2051
                                        [5]             1467
                                        [6]             1952
                                        [7]             4931
                                        [8]             783
                                        [9]             902  
TDCT                            FLOAT   10    4     3m   0   RWD
                                        [0]             503
                                        [1]             679
                                        [2]             321
                                        [3]             1072
                                        [4]             760
                                        [5]             2315
                                        [6]             474
                                        [7]             846
                                        [8]             39
                                        [9]             691



Event containing two Named Banks of different sizes

If the equipment contains several banks that cannot share the same "Names[]" array, individual "Names" arrays can be set up for each bank. The banks then may be of different lengths. The following examples shows an equipment named "Target" that has two named banks, SCLR and TGT_ .




Clicking on "Detector" Equipment Hyperlink shows SCLR and TGT_ bank contents each with defined Names





In this case, instead of one "Names" array, an array has been defined for each bank of the form "Names <bankname>[<Len>]" where

  • <bankname> is the name of the bank and
  • <Len> is the length of the bank.

Note that two extra hyperlinks appear on the "Groups" line. These Group Hyperlinks are labelled as the name of each bank, and provide a shortcut to the top of the bank, useful when the bank is very large.

Shown below are the contents of the arrays "Names TGT_" and "Names SCAL" in /Equipment/target/settings: 

ls /Equipment/target/settings
Names TGT_
                                Time
                                Cryostat vacuum
                                Heat Pipe pressure
                                Target pressure
                                Target temperature
                                Shield temperature
                                Diode temperature
                                Diode current
                                Laser intensity
                                gas pressure
                                gas temperature
Names SCAL
                                LSeg0
                                LSeg1
                                LSeg2
                                LSeg3
                                RSeg0
                                RSeg1
                                RSeg2
                                RSeg3
[local:t2kgas:S]/Equipment>

and the contents of /Equipment/target/variables showing the two corresponding banks TGT_ and SCAL : 

[local:t2kgas:S]/Equipment>ls /Equipment/target/variables
SCAL
                                3453
                                2701
                                896
                                4351
                                2051
                                1467
                                1952
TGT_
                                114059
                                4.661
                                23.16
                                -0.498
                                22.888
                                82.099
                                40
                                14.2
                                9.871
                                -70.9



Names array Grouped for a large number of elements in a bank

This example shows the main status page of an experiment which has a number of Equipments defined. The Equipment Hyperlink of the Equipment "cycle_scalers" ( MIDAS format) has been clicked. This hyperlink is circled in the following illustration. The resulting pages show the list of variables in the bank HSCL. This large bank has been divided into the groups:

  • All Back Front Scaler_B General

The names of the Groups appear in the Groups line of the Equipment pages. The example shows the complete bank ("All" which is the default) as well as the Groups of scalers which appears when each Group Hyperlink (circled) is pressed.




Clicking on the Equipment Hyperlink "cycle_scalers" on Status page showing "All" scaler values, plus the defined Groups






The illustration above shows how the mhttpd display combines the names of the variables in a MIDAS format event with the variables read out in the Equipment's databank. The "cycle_scalers" equipment has been set up in the ODB so that the scaler names are listed under the array "Names" in /Equipment/Cycle_Scalers/Settings. Since there are a great many scalers in this one bank, they have been divided into the groups "Back" "Front" "ScalerB" and "General" in the Names array using a "<group>%" construct as shown below:

[local:bnmr:S]>cd /Equipment/Cycle_Scalers/Settings
[local:bnmr:S]Settings>ls
Names
                                Back%BSeg00
                                Back%BSeg01
                                Back%BSeg02
                                Back%BSeg03
                                Back%BSeg04
                                Back%BSeg05
                                Back%BSeg06
                                Back%BSeg07
                                Back%BSeg08
                                Back%BSeg09
                                Back%BSeg10
                                Back%BSeg11
                                Back%BSeg12
                                Back%BSeg13
                                Back%BSeg14
                                Back%BSeg15
                                Front%FSeg00
                                Front%FSeg01
                                Front%FSeg02
                                Front%FSeg03
                                Front%FSeg04
                                Front%FSeg05
                                Front%FSeg06
                                Front%FSeg07
                                Front%FSeg08
                                Front%FSeg09
                                Front%FSeg10
                                Front%FSeg11
                                Front%FSeg12
                                Front%FSeg13
                                Front%FSeg14
                                Front%FSeg15
                                Scaler_B%SIS Ref pulse
                                Scaler_B%Fluor. mon 2
                                Scaler_B%Polariz Left
                                Scaler_B%Polariz Right
                                Scaler_B%Neutral Beam B1
                                Scaler_B%Neutral Beam B2
                                Scaler_B%Neutral Beam B3
                                Scaler_B%Neutral Beam B4
                                Scaler_B%Neutral Beam F1
                                Scaler_B%Neutral Beam F2
                                Scaler_B%Neutral Beam F3
                                Scaler_B%Neutral Beam F4
                                General%Back Userbit=0
                                General%Back Userbit=1
                                General%Back Userbit=2
                                General%Back Userbit=3
                                General%Front Userbit=0
                                General%Front Userbit=1
                                General%Front Userbit=2
                                General%Front Userbit=3
                                General%Back Cycle Sum
                                General%Front Cycle Sum
                                General%B/F Cycle
                                General%Asym Cycle
                                General%Pol Cycle Sum
                                General%Pol Cycle Asym
                                General%NeutBm Cycle Sum
                                General%NeutBm Cycle Asym
[local:bnmr:S]Settings>



Fixed-Format event with named Variables

An example of a FIXED format event is shown below. The equipment "Info ODB" is defined as FIXED-format. The variables are of different types, so cannot be output as a MIDAS event. In this example, there is no information listed in the subdirectory Settings for this equipment. The name of each element is listed in the "Variables" subtree. The Settings subtree is not defined.




Clicking on the "Info ODB" Equipment Hyperlink on Status page showing the FIXED format event 





[local:bnmr:S]Settings>ls "/Equipment/Info ODB/"
Common
Statistics
Variables

The names of the variables for this FIXED-format event are in the /Equipment/Info ODB/Variables subtree, i.e.

[local:bnmr:S]>ls -lt "/Equipment/Info ODB/Variables"
Key name                        Type    #Val  Size  Last Opn Mode Value
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
helicity                        DWORD   1     4     8h   0   RWD  0
current cycle                   DWORD   1     4     8h   0   RWD  710
cancelled cycle                 DWORD   1     4     8h   0   RWD  9
current scan                    DWORD   1     4     8h   0   RWD  13
Ref HelUp thr                   DOUBLE  1     8     8h   0   RWD  6626873
Ref HelDown thr                 DOUBLE  1     8     8h   0   RWD  6626873
Current HelUp thr               DOUBLE  1     8     8h   0   RWD  6659381
Current HelDown thr             DOUBLE  1     8     8h   0   RWD  75
Prev HelUp thr                  DOUBLE  1     8     8h   0   RWD  6652944
Prev HelDown thr                DOUBLE  1     8     8h   0   RWD  133
RF state                        DWORD   1     4     8h   0   RWD  0
Fluor monitor counts            DWORD   1     4     8h   0   RWD  0
EpicsDev Set(V)                 FLOAT   1     4     8h   0   RWD  0
EpicsDev Read(V)                FLOAT   1     4     8h   0   RWD  0
Campdev set                     FLOAT   1     4     8h   0   RWD  0
Campdev read                    FLOAT   1     4     8h   0   RWD  0
Laser Power(V)                  FLOAT   1     4     8h   0   RWD  0
last failed thr test            DWORD   1     4     8h   0   RWD  0
cycle when last failed thr      DWORD   1     4     8h   0   RWD  710
last good hel                   DWORD   1     4     8h   0   RWD  1
ncycle sk tol                   DWORD   1     4     8h   0   RWD  2
hel_read                        DWORD   1     4     8h   0   RWD  9
[local:bnmr:S]>

Fixed-Format event with defined Names array

Alternatively, if the FIXED format event consists of an array , a "Names" array can be defined in the same way as for the MIDAS event. In this case, each element of the array under "Variables" will be referenced using the equivalent elements of the "Settings/Names" array, as shown in the following example:


FIXED format event with a "Names" array defined





This event is defined as follows:

[local:t2kgas:S]/>cd /Equipment/parameters

[local:t2kgas:S]/parameters>ls  -rlt
    ...............
    Variables                   DIR
        IODB                    STRING  5     32    26m  0   RWD
                                        [0]             123352
                                        [1]             pulse
                                        [2]             43.21
                                        [3]             DRT_9
                                        [4]             0.321
    settings                    DIR
        Names                   STRING  5     32    10m  0   RWD
                                        [0]             Rejected
                                        [1]             Type
                                        [2]             LTX Voltage
                                        [3]             Trig type
                                        [4]             PXV Current
